Notes

Module Summary

Module containing the Note class and related variables and functions.

Global variables

notes.NATURAL_NOTES: list[str]

Contains all 7 natural notes.

notes.ACCIDENTAL_NOTES: list[tuple]

Contains all accidents with enharmonics in tuples.

notes.ALL_NOTE_NAMES: list[str]

Contains all note names, including sharps and flats.

notes.FLAT_KEYS: list[str]

Contains scale keys that have flats.

notes.SHARP_KEYS: list[str]

Contains scale keys that have sharps.

Exceptions

InvalidNoteNameError: Exception raised by an invalid note name.

Functions

enharmonize_note(): Get a note’s enharmonic.

note_input(): Receive input and turns into a Note object.

display_chromatic_scale(): Output a message with chromatic scale.

all_about_note(): Return all information on a note.

run(): Run the module as a script.

Classes

Note: Defines a note and its methods.

ChromaticScaleGenerator: Defines a base scale generator.

Exceptions

exception notes.InvalidNoteNameError(message='Invalid note name: ', name='')

Exception raised when a note is instantiated with invalid name.

Supports custom message and displaying the invalid name.

Functions

notes.enharmonize_note(note_obj: Note) → Note

Get the enharmonic of a note.

If the argument note is accidental, returns a note object corresponding to the note name’s pair in ACCIDENTAL_NOTES.

Returns:

The note’s enharmonic (same sound, opposite accident).

Return type:

Note

notes.note_input(message='Insert the note you want to know about: ') → Note

Receive input of a note name and returns a note object.

Starts a loop (so eventually a right input is received), receives the input and does error handling for the possible InvalidNoteNameError.

Parameters:

message (str) – A custom message, for reusability in other modules.

Returns:

The object corresponding to the input.

Return type:

Note

notes.display_chromatic_scale(note_obj: Note) → str

Display a message containing the chromatic scale of a given note.

First, generates a chromatic scale using generate(). Then extracts the note names using a list comprehension and join them to a message, returning it after.

Parameters:

note_obj (Note) – Chosen note to make the scale upon.

Returns:

A message containing the note’s scale.

Return type:

str

notes.all_about_note(note_obj: Note) → str

Display all information on a given note object.

Parameters:

note_obj (Note) – The given note.

Returns:

A message containing all the information.

Return type:

str

Classes

Note Summary

class notes.Note(name: str)

Class that define notes and their methods.

Attributes

name: str

The name of the note (e.g.: “D#”).

accident_sign: str

The symbol of the accident the note has (e.g.: “#”).

Methods

is_accidental(): Check if the note has an accident.

is_flat(): Check if the note is flat.

is_sharp(): Check if the note is sharp.

__init__(name: str)

Instantiate a note.

Raises an exception if the note’s name not in ALL_NOTE_NAMES, and initializes an empty accident_sign.

Parameters:

name (str) – Passed to name.

Note Methods

Note.is_accidental() → bool

Check if the note has an accident in its name.

If the note has an accident, sets accident_sign to it.

Note.is_flat() → bool

Check if the note is flat using its accident sign.

Note.is_sharp() → bool

Check if the note is sharp using its accident sign.

ChromaticScaleGenerator

class notes.ChromaticScaleGenerator(root: Note)

Defines a generator for chromatic scales.

Attributes

root: Note

Note to be used as root of the generator.

notes: list[Note]

List of notes generated to form the scale.

Methods

generate_base_scale(): Generate a scale with root in C.

generate(): Generate a chromatic scale based on the root.

__init__(root: Note)

Initialize the generator with an empty note list.

Parameters:

root (Note) – Passed to root.

ChromaticScaleGenerator Methods

ChromaticScaleGenerator.generate_base_scale()

Generate a scale with proper accidents and root in C.

ChromaticScaleGenerator.generate()

Generate the root’s chromatic scale.

Calls generate_base_scale() and then iterates through the notes to find the root’s index, manipulating the list to start it by the root.
